main event: A witness observed a bright light flashing at irregular intervals in the sky over Skaneateles, New York in 1964.
interesting points: The light traveled easterly and disappeared after approximately 3 seconds.
The light was described as similar to a flashing full moon, being as large and a little brighter than the full moon.
The light was so bright that it lit up the whole sky when it flashed on.
The witness saw similar lights flashing on and off in 1-2 second intervals before the main sighting.
The witness could not see the ground near the light, only the bright light in the sky.
